Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:


2.5 μM 2-ME, 5 μM 4-HPR, 1 μg/ml TOC, 2.5 μM 2-ME and 1 μg/ml TOC (2T), 5 μM 4-HPR and 2.5 μM 2-ME (4T), 5 μM 4-HPR and 2.5 μM 2-ME (2+4), or 5 μM 4-HPR, 2.5 μM 2-ME, and 1 μg/ml TOC (Triple) (initial agent concentrations same for single and combinations).
TOC q.d. (0.3 μg/100 μl PBS)+PLGA blank implant, 5) 2-ME (1 μg/100 μl PBS, b.i.d.)+4-HPR releasing PLGA implant, 6) 2-ME (1 μg/100 μl PBS, b.i.d.)+TOC q.d. (0.3 μg/100 μl PBS)+blank PLGA implant, 7) TOC q.d. (0.3 μg/100 μl PBS)+4-HPR releasing PLGA implant, 8) 2-ME (1 μg/100 μl PBS, b.i.d.)+TOC q.d. (0.3 μg/100 μl PBS)+4-HPR releasing PLGA implant.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:


In vitro release can be determined at 37° C. under perfect sink conditions using PBS+0.084% Tween 80, which provides the same fenretinide solubility (21 μg/mL) as found in bovine serum.
The drug release could also be strongly increased by numerous additives (for example β-cyclodextrin, Pluronic F127, or PEG8000) to affect the drug solubility and/or pore formation of the polymer throughout the release period.
Release kinetics in vitro can be performed in PBS+0.02% Tween 80 (PBST) at 37° C. under perfect sink conditions with HPLC detection.
In vitro release can be conducted at 37° C. in PBST as for 2-ME, except analysis can be by SEC and ELISA.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

* 5×10<sup>5 </sup>JSCC1 cells (tumorsphere-formation competent unlike JSCC2 and JSCC3 cells) were plated in complete medium with either vehicle control (0.01% DMSO) or 5 μM 4-HPR in Corning Ultra-Low attachment tissue culture flasks (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, Mo.)
* Twenty four hour sera-deprived cells were treated for an additional 24 hours in sera free media with the following: ... 4) 1 μg/ml tocilizumab (TOC, ˜2.55 μM) 
* Sera-free conditioned media for IL-6, VEGF, TGF-α and EGF were analyzed by ELISAs (R&D Systems, Minneapolis, Minn.), with data expressed as pg/10<sup>6 </sup>cells.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:


2-ME (1 μg/100 μl PBS, b.i.d.)+blank PLGA implant, 
2-ME (1 μg/100 μl PBS, b.i.d.)+4-HPR releasing PLGA implant, 
2-ME (1 μg/100 μl PBS, b.i.d.)+TOC q.d. (0.3 μg/100 μl PBS)+blank PLGA implant, 
TOC q.d. (0.3 μg/100 μl PBS)+PLGA blank implant, 
TOC q.d. (0.3μg/100 μl PBS)+4-HPR releasing PLGA implant, 
2-ME (1 μg/100 μl PBS, b.i.d.) +TOC q.d. (0.3μg/100 μl PBS)+4-HPR releasing PLGA implant.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

* 4-HPR implants released between 300-370 μg drug and achieved tissue levels of 331+/−134 μM.
* 4-HPR sera levels were below LLOQ (<50 ng/ml) in all mice that received PLGA implants.
* IL-6 levels detected (range ˜100-1,600 pg/10<sup>6 </sup>cells) were comparable to IL-6 release from other human cancer cells (ovarian 100-200 pg/10<sup>6 </sup>cells, prostate 850-1250 pg/10<sup>6 </sup>cells) 
* VEGF release (range ˜1,000-3,000 pg/10<sup>6 </sup>cells) also compared favorably to previous OSCC cell data (1,500 pg/10<sup>6 </sup>cells)

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

* Despite achieving tumor 4-HPR levels that were appreciably greater than apoptosis-inducing 10 μM [21], 4-HPR implants only significantly inhibited tumor growth when used with other agents.
* Although two established apoptosis-inducing drugs (2-ME and 4-HPR) were employed, low levels of cleaved caspase 3 were detected in all groups (FIGS. 6. and 6C), and 4-HPR was used at levels greater than apoptosis-inducing 10 μM. 
* Additionally, tocilizumab (100 μg i.p.) significantly reduced HNSCC tumor initiation in scid mice; 
* In contrast, the data showed appreciably lower local tocilizumab doses (0.3 μg q.d.) significantly inhibited OSCC tumor growth.
